item.title: 01 Intro
item.description: The word Nyāya has so many connotative facets in Sanskrit and in other Indian languages that one has to ascertian the exact connotation of Nyāya in the concerned work. Though Nyāya often means justice, it expresses many more meanings. Infact, Apte’s Dictionary has assigned the following twelve sets of meaning to this word. (i) Method, manner (ii) Fitness, propriety (iii) Low, justice, Virtue, equity, righteousness. (iv) A law suit, (v) Judicial sentence, (vi) Policy, good government (vii) A popular maxim (viii) An opposite illustration, (ix) Vedic account.
